questions.question: In the following figure which zone is interpreted as potential groundwater resources

answers.a: 3000 Ωm to > 15000 Ωm (light red to dark purple)
answers.d: 6 Ωm to 150 Ωm (dark blue to light blue)

explanations.d: The lower resistivity values are around 6 Ω m to 150 Ω m (indicated bythe color of  dark blue to light blue) which are located mostly on theupper central part and also in the left side  of the section. They areinterpreted as potential groundwater resources in unconfined aquifers in the area.

questions.question: Wenner-Schlumberger is used as it is moderately sensitive to both horizontal and vertical structures.
The method to determine the vertical changes in resistivity is known as

explanations.c: Apparent resistivity measurements involve systematically altering electrode spacings while conducting measurements at a single location or around a central point. This method is referred to as Vertical Electrical Sounding (VES) or Vertical Profiling.

questions.question: Vertical resolution on a seismic section is dependent on what factors?

answers.a: The bandwidth of the wavelet or signal
answers.b: The main frequency present in the wavelet or signal
answers.c: The thickness of the beds that are being imaged

explanations.d: Vertical resolution on a seismic section is dependent on multiple factors, and all of the factors play a role in determining the quality of vertical resolution in seismic data.

questions.question: When salinbity changes occur in a vertical profile

answers.a: The lower portion of the aquifer should be tapped
answers.b: The upper portion of thr aquifer should be tapped
answers.c: The middle portion of the aquifer should be tapped
answers.d: The whole aquifer should be tapped
